name: Bengal Tiger
long_description: The Bengal Tiger is a majestic carnivore, recognized for its distinctive orange coat with black stripes. It is an apex predator found in the Indian subcontinent.

name: Bald Eagle
long_description: The Bald Eagle, a symbol of freedom, is a large bird of prey. It inhabits diverse landscapes and is known for its striking appearance with a white head and yellow beak.

name: Giant Panda
long_description: The Giant Panda is an iconic black-and-white bear known for its bamboo diet. Endangered, it resides in the mountainous regions of China and symbolizes wildlife conservation.

name: Green Sea Turtle
long_description: The Green Sea Turtle is a marine reptile found in tropical oceans. Known for its green color and gentle nature, it is threatened by habitat loss and plastic pollution.

name: African Elephant
long_description: The African Elephant is the largest land mammal, with distinctive large ears and tusks. It plays a crucial role in maintaining ecosystems across the African continent.

name: Great White Shark
countries: Global, in temperate and tropical seas
long_description: The Great White Shark is a powerful apex predator in the ocean. With its fearsome reputation, it roams the world's seas, playing a vital role in marine ecosystems.

name: Koala
long_description: The Koala is an arboreal marsupial known for its cuddly appearance. It exclusively feeds on eucalyptus leaves and is native to the eucalyptus forests of Australia.

name: Amazon River Dolphin
long_description: The Amazon River Dolphin, also known as the pink river dolphin, is a unique freshwater mammal found in the Amazon River. It is known for its pink coloration and social behavior.

name: Snow Leopard
long_description: The Snow Leopard is a solitary and elusive big cat adapted to high-altitude mountain environments. Its thick fur helps it survive the cold, harsh conditions.

name: Poison Dart Frog
long_description: The Poison Dart Frog, vibrant in color, is found in Central and South American rainforests. Some species of these small frogs secrete toxic compounds through their skin.

name: Red Kangaroo
long_description: The Red Kangaroo is the largest marsupial and is known for its powerful hind legs. It inhabits the arid regions of Australia, utilizing its strong tail for balance.

name: Orangutan
long_description: The Orangutan, an arboreal ape, is found in the rainforests of Borneo and Sumatra. Known for their intelligence, they face threats due to habitat loss and illegal hunting.

name: Arctic Fox
long_description: The Arctic Fox is adapted to cold climates, with a thick fur coat that changes color with the seasons. It inhabits the Arctic tundra and survives in harsh winter conditions.

name: Giraffe
long_description: The Giraffe is the tallest land animal, known for its long neck and distinctive spotted coat. It roams the savannas of Africa, browsing on leaves from tall trees.

name: Polar Bear
long_description: The Polar Bear is superbly adapted to its Arctic environment, with a thick layer of blubber and a white coat. It relies on sea ice to hunt seals and survive in extreme cold.

name: Hummingbird
long_description: The Hummingbird, known for its rapid wing beats and vibrant plumage, is found in various habitats across the Americas. It feeds on nectar from flowers and plays a vital role in pollination.
